sentences.literal: Duke Ping said: 'Can one hear it?'

sentences.chinese: 師曠曰：「君德義薄，不可以聽之。」
sentences.literal: Master Kuang said: 'My lord's virtue and righteousness thin, cannot listen to it.'

sentences.chinese: 平公曰：「寡人所好者音也，願聞之。」
sentences.literal: Duke Ping said: 'I what like is sound, wish to hear it.'

sentences.chinese: 師曠不得已，援琴而鼓之。
sentences.literal: Master Kuang had no choice, took up zither and played it.

sentences.chinese: 一奏之，有玄鶴二八集乎廊門；
sentences.literal: One played it, had dark cranes sixteen gathered at corridor gate;

sentences.chinese: 再奏之，延頸而鳴，舒翼而舞。
sentences.literal: Twice played it, stretched necks and called, spread wings and danced.

sentences.chinese: 平公大喜，起而為師曠壽。
sentences.literal: Duke Ping greatly delighted, rose and toasted Master Kuang.

sentences.chinese: 反坐，問曰：「音無此最悲乎？」
sentences.literal: Returned to seat, asked saying: 'Sound nothing more sorrowful than this?'

sentences.chinese: 昔者黃帝以大合鬼神，今君德義薄，不足以聽之，聽之將敗。」
sentences.literal: Formerly Yellow Emperor used it greatly to unite ghosts and spirits, now my lord virtue righteousness thin, insufficient to listen to it, listening will cause defeat.'

sentences.chinese: 平公曰：「寡人老矣，所好者音也，願遂聞之。」
sentences.literal: Duke Ping said: 'I am old, what like is sound, wish to continue hearing it.'

sentences.chinese: 師曠不得已，援琴而鼓之。
sentences.literal: Master Kuang had no choice, took up zither and played it.

sentences.chinese: 一奏之，有白雲從西北起；
sentences.literal: One played it, had white clouds from northwest rise;

sentences.chinese: 再奏之，大風至而雨隨之，飛廊瓦，左右皆奔走。
sentences.literal: Twice played it, great wind arrived and rain followed it, flew corridor tiles, left and right all fled running.
